title: France PM Michel Barnier resigns after no confidence motion, to stay in office till new government named
content: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier resigned after a historic no-confidence vote ousted his government. This marks the first successful such vote since 1962. President Macron faces pressure to quickly appoint a successor amid a hung parliament and political instability. Barnier's controversial budget proposal triggered the crisis, leaving France without an approved budget.
summary: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier resigned after a historic no-confidence vote ousted his government. This marks the first successful such vote since 1962. President Macron faces pressure to quickly appoint a successor amid a hung parliament and political instability. Barnier's controversial budget proposal triggered the crisis, leaving France without an approved budget.

title: 'Poetic Justice': Why some Americans are celebrating UnitedHealthcare CEO’s murder
content: The shocking murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson has sparked polarised reactions, highlighting the deep frustration many Americans feel toward the US healthcare system. Thompson’s leadership symbolised a profit-driven industry criticised for denying care and financial exploitation. Social media flooded with dark humour and anger, with some viewing his death as karmic justice. Journalist Taylor Lorenz's meme further fuelled controversy, reflecting the public’s disdain for systemic inequities. While critics warn against normalising violence, the incident underscores a growing demand for universal healthcare and reform. Thompson’s death serves as a grim symbol of a healthcare system many believe is irreparably broken.
summary: The shocking murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson has sparked polarised reactions, highlighting the deep frustration many Americans feel toward the US healthcare system. Thompson’s leadership symbolised a profit-driven industry criticised for denying care and financial exploitation. Social media flooded with dark humour and anger, with some viewing his death as karmic justice. Journalist Taylor Lorenz's meme further fuelled controversy, reflecting the public’s disdain for systemic inequities. While critics warn against normalising violence, the incident underscores a growing demand for universal healthcare and reform. Thompson’s death serves as a grim symbol of a healthcare system many believe is irreparably broken.

title: Does Donald Trump have an IQ of 73? What is the truth behind this viral claim?
content: How much is Donald Trump's IQ? The answer is not known as he never released his IQ score though he took jibes at Joe Biden and Kamala Harris and all other opponents by calling them low-IQ persons. In 2019, the claim that Donald Trump's IQ is 73 went viral. The same clip resurfaced on X Thursday making the same claim. An IQ of 73 indicated mental retardation.
summary: How much is Donald Trump's IQ? The answer is not known as he never released his IQ score though he took jibes at Joe Biden and Kamala Harris and all other opponents by calling them low-IQ persons. In 2019, the claim that Donald Trump's IQ is 73 went viral. The same clip resurfaced on X Thursday making the same claim. An IQ of 73 indicated mental retardation.

title: China sanctions 13 US military firms over Taiwan arms sales​​
content: China imposed sanctions on 13 US military companies and six executives following US arms sales to Taiwan and President Lai Ching-te's US transit. Beijing views the $385 million arms deal, including F-16 support, as a threat to its sovereignty and opposes Taiwan's leader's foreign interactions, considering Taiwan its territory.
summary: China imposed sanctions on 13 US military companies and six executives following US arms sales to Taiwan and President Lai Ching-te's US transit.  Beijing views the $385 million arms deal, including F-16 support, as a threat to its sovereignty and opposes Taiwan's leader's foreign interactions, considering Taiwan its territory.

title: Viral post decodes 'deny, depose...' message on bullets that killed UnitedHealthcare CEO
content: ​ A post has now claimed to have decoded the encrypted message and divulged the eerie link between the three words and the title of a book by Jay M Feinman 'Delay Deny Defend'. The book is about insurance companies which drag their feet on paying the claims and UnitedHealthcare is an insurance company. "Why insurance companies don't pay claims and what you can do about it," the description of the book reads.
summary: ​ A post has now claimed to have decoded the encrypted message and divulged the eerie link between the three words and the title of a book by Jay M Feinman 'Delay Deny Defend'. The book is about insurance companies which drag their feet on paying the claims and UnitedHealthcare is an insurance company. "Why insurance companies don't pay claims and what you can do about it," the description of the book reads.

title: Pete Hegseth comes clean on drinking problem allegations: 'What do guys do when...'
content: Pete Hegseth said he like all normal guys have had a glass of beer or two but he never had a stinking problem. He never had to be counseled for that either. But you know, what do guys do when they come back from war oftentimes? Have some beers. How do you deal with the demons you see on the battlefield? Sometimes it's with a bottle."
summary: Pete Hegseth said he like all normal guys have had a glass of beer or two but he never had a stinking problem. He never had to be counseled for that either. But you know, what do guys do when they come back from war oftentimes? Have some beers. How do you deal with the demons you see on the battlefield? Sometimes it's with a bottle."

title: Did UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killer leave a clue in nearby Starbucks?
content: The killer made a stop at the nearby Starbucks just before the killing and bought a coffee, a water bottle and two power bars from the store. In the surveillance footage, he was seen tossing the coffee cup and the water bottle in the trash can. the NYPD investigators are decoding if the killer left some vital clues apart from the "deny", "depose", and "defend" engraved in the shell casings.
summary: The killer made a stop at the nearby Starbucks just before the killing and bought a coffee, a water bottle and two power bars from the store. In the surveillance footage, he was seen tossing the coffee cup and the water bottle in the trash can. the NYPD investigators are decoding if the killer left some vital clues apart from the "deny", "depose", and "defend" engraved in the shell casings.

title: 'My ears are bleeding': Why SC Justice Ketanji Jackson comparing gender surgery for minors to interracial marriage is sparking fury
content: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson compared bans on gender-affirming care to interracial marriage prohibitions during a Supreme Court hearing, sparking debate. Critics argue her analogy conflates distinct legal issues, as Loving v. Virginia addressed racial discrimination under strict scrutiny, while gender-affirming care involves medical and ethical complexities, subject to differing standards of review. The comparison also highlights disparities in public acceptance; interracial marriage is widely supported, while gender-affirming care remains contentious. Some view Jackson's remarks as judicial activism, framing the issue as a civil rights imperative. The debate underscores tensions between state authority, evolving public opinion, and courts' role in safeguarding equality.
summary: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson compared bans on gender-affirming care to interracial marriage prohibitions during a Supreme Court hearing, sparking debate. Critics argue her analogy conflates distinct legal issues, as Loving v. Virginia addressed racial discrimination under strict scrutiny, while gender-affirming care involves medical and ethical complexities, subject to differing standards of review. The comparison also highlights disparities in public acceptance; interracial marriage is widely supported, while gender-affirming care remains contentious. Some view Jackson's remarks as judicial activism, framing the issue as a civil rights imperative. The debate underscores tensions between state authority, evolving public opinion, and courts' role in safeguarding equality.

title: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces investigation amid martial law controversy
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces an impeachment vote following his controversial attempt to impose martial law. Accusations of treason against Yoon and top officials are under investigation by police, spurred by an opposition complaint. The move to declare martial law, which included deploying troops to parliament, sparked public outrage and international concern.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces an impeachment vote following his controversial attempt to impose martial law. Accusations of treason against Yoon and top officials are under investigation by police, spurred by an opposition complaint. The move to declare martial law, which included deploying troops to parliament, sparked public outrage and international concern.

title: Hawk Tuah Girl’s $HAWK Meme Coin crashes minutes after launch
content: The $HAWK debacle highlights the inherent risks of investing in meme coins, which are often driven by speculative behavior and subject to extreme volatility. The incident has drawn sharp criticism online, with many calling for stricter oversight of cryptocurrency projects to prevent such outcomes in the future.
summary: The $HAWK debacle highlights the inherent risks of investing in meme coins, which are often driven by speculative behavior and subject to extreme volatility. The incident has drawn sharp criticism online, with many calling for stricter oversight of cryptocurrency projects to prevent such outcomes in the future.

title: Watch: This German engineer's underwater home has a bed, toilet, TV, computer, clocks, internet and more
content: German aerospace engineer, Rudiger Koch, is currently living 36 feet underwater off Panama's coast in a submersible capsule. He aims to spend 120 days submerged, breaking the current record. Koch's experiment explores the ocean's potential for human habitation, advocating for ocean-based communities. His capsule provides basic amenities, and he's monitored for health and safety.
summary: German aerospace engineer, Rudiger Koch, is currently living 36 feet underwater off Panama's coast in a submersible capsule. He aims to spend 120 days submerged, breaking the current record. Koch's experiment explores the ocean's potential for human habitation, advocating for ocean-based communities. His capsule provides basic amenities, and he's monitored for health and safety.

title: 'No burgers, soft drinks and burgers': UK bans daytime TV ads for junk food in bid to tackle child obesity
content: The UK government will introduce a 9 pm watershed ban on TV adverts for unhealthy foods high in sugar, fat, and salt, starting October next year. This measure aims to combat rising childhood obesity rates, impacting products like granola, muffins, and pastries, but excluding general fast-food chain advertising.
summary: The UK government will introduce a 9 pm watershed ban on TV adverts for unhealthy foods high in sugar, fat, and salt, starting October next year. This measure aims to combat rising childhood obesity rates, impacting products like granola, muffins, and pastries, but excluding general fast-food chain advertising.

title: No Russian oil flowing through Druzhba pipeline to Czech Republic, Unipetrol says
content: Russian oil flows to the Czech Republic via the Druzhba pipeline have been mysteriously halted, leaving Czech refiner Unipetrol relying on reserves. While officials assure the public fuel supplies remain unaffected, the stoppage's cause is still under investigation.
summary: Russian oil flows to the Czech Republic via the Druzhba pipeline have been mysteriously halted, leaving Czech refiner Unipetrol relying on reserves. While officials assure the public fuel supplies remain unaffected, the stoppage's cause is still under investigation.

title: The troubled history of South Korean presidents
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces impeachment after a controversial move to suspend civilian rule. This follows a pattern of tumultuous presidential tenures marked by corruption, scandal, and even suicide. Previous leaders like Park Geun-hye and Lee Myung-bak were jailed for corruption, while Roh Moo-hyun tragically took his own life amid investigations.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces impeachment after a controversial move to suspend civilian rule. This follows a pattern of tumultuous presidential tenures marked by corruption, scandal, and even suicide. Previous leaders like Park Geun-hye and Lee Myung-bak were jailed for corruption, while Roh Moo-hyun tragically took his own life amid investigations.

title: Ukraine imposes sanctions on Ivanishvili, some members of Georgia government
content: Ukraine's President sanctioned Georgia's former Prime Minister and officials. Zelenskiy accused them of pro-Russian leanings. Georgia's governing party faces accusations of authoritarianism. Tensions escalated after Georgia suspended EU accession talks. Protests and clashes with police followed. Zelenskiy urged international action against Georgia's government.
summary: Ukraine's President sanctioned Georgia's former Prime Minister and officials.  Zelenskiy accused them of pro-Russian leanings.  Georgia's governing party faces accusations of authoritarianism.  Tensions escalated after Georgia suspended EU accession talks.  Protests and clashes with police followed. Zelenskiy urged international action against Georgia's government.

title: Why Amazon's founder Jeff Bezos is very optimistic about Trump 2.0?
content: Jeff Bezos expressed optimism about the Trump administration, citing potential deregulation benefits. He defended his decision against The Washington Post endorsing candidates and aimed to dispel Trump's perceived media hostility. Bezos also downplayed concerns about Elon Musk's influence on regulatory reforms impacting their space ventures.
summary: Jeff Bezos expressed optimism about the Trump administration, citing potential deregulation benefits.  He defended his decision against The Washington Post endorsing candidates and aimed to dispel Trump's perceived media hostility. Bezos also downplayed concerns about Elon Musk's influence on regulatory reforms impacting their space ventures.

title: 'Tens of thousands of hours of footage': How cops plan to hunt down Brian Thompson's killer
content: In a brazen Manhattan shooting, UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed Wednesday morning. The NYPD is leveraging its extensive surveillance network, including footage from public and private cameras, to track the skilled gunman who fled into Central Park. Despite capturing the suspect's movements, his identity and motive remain unknown, highlighting the challenges of even the most sophisticated surveillance systems.
summary: In a brazen Manhattan shooting, UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed Wednesday morning.  The NYPD is leveraging its extensive surveillance network, including footage from public and private cameras, to track the skilled gunman who fled into Central Park. Despite capturing the suspect's movements, his identity and motive remain unknown, highlighting the challenges of even the most sophisticated surveillance systems.

title: Detectives uncover new evidences in Brian Thompson's murder case
content: A masked gunman shot and killed UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan. Shell casings inscribed with "deny," "defend," and "depose" were found at the scene. The assailant fled on an e-bike into Central Park, and police are searching for a potential witness seen fleeing the scene.
summary: A masked gunman shot and killed UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan.  Shell casings inscribed with "deny," "defend," and "depose" were found at the scene. The assailant fled on an e-bike into Central Park, and police are searching for a potential witness seen fleeing the scene.

title: Isro begins revised countdown for Proba-3 mission launch
content: Isro launched ESA's Proba-3 mission on December 5th, after a delay due to a propulsion system anomaly. The two satellites will study the Sun's corona by flying in precise formation, a key demonstration for future missions. This marks ESA's return to launching with Isro after 23 years and follows Isro's recent Aditya-L1 solar mission.
summary: Isro launched ESA's Proba-3 mission on December 5th, after a delay due to a propulsion system anomaly.  The two satellites will study the Sun's corona by flying in precise formation, a key demonstration for future missions. This marks ESA's return to launching with Isro after 23 years and follows Isro's recent Aditya-L1 solar mission.

title: Ex-defence chief suggested martial law to President Yoon, says South Korean interior minister
content: South Korean Defense Minister Kim Yong-hyun resigned after allegedly suggesting martial law to President Yoon Suk Yeol. President Yoon declared martial law, citing North Korean threats, and deployed troops to parliament. An impeachment motion against Yoon is scheduled for a parliamentary vote on Saturday. Choi Byung-huk has been selected as the new defense minister.
summary: South Korean Defense Minister Kim Yong-hyun resigned after allegedly suggesting martial law to President Yoon Suk Yeol.  President Yoon declared martial law, citing North Korean threats, and deployed troops to parliament.  An impeachment motion against Yoon is scheduled for a parliamentary vote on Saturday.  Choi Byung-huk has been selected as the new defense minister.
